author: cbs8
title: Welcome Back! All Roads Are Open And Lead To Myrtle Beach, S.C.
text:
Visit Myrtle Beach
The Myrtle Beach Area Welcomes Visitors With Open Roads, Sunshine
MYRTLE BEACH, S.C. , Oct. 14, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- The Myrtle Beach area of South Carolina is busy welcoming visitors to its 60 miles of gorgeous coastline, with all roads leading to and throughout the destination open and local businesses and attractions offering seasonal discounts. The Myrtle Beach area is currently enjoying beach-like weather and is expected to continue to experience warm temperatures in the coming weeks.
"We couldn't be happier to be welcoming visitors to the beautiful Myrtle Beach area during what we locals refer to as the best time of year to visit," said Brad Dean , president and CEO of the Myrtle Beach Area Chamber of Commerce. "We feel very fortunate to have experienced such a minor setback in our weather and to have had our roads open for travel so quickly, allowing our visitors ease and safety as they head to the beach. With all hotels and attractions open for business and beautiful weather in the forecast, we expect a typical, busy week ahead for visitors and businesses alike."
Beach-goers will enjoy area attractions, restaurants and accommodations alongside even more affordable rates with the Myrtle Beach area's fall campaign " Relax and Unwind: 60 More Days of Summer ." Through October, myriad attractions and accommodations offer deals for travelers looking to get away this fall. For more information visit www.visitmyrtlebeach.com/60days .
About Myrtle Beach , S.C.
Stretching from Little River to Pawleys Island and comprising 12 distinct communities, the Myrtle Beach area is home to 60 miles of sandy beaches, an assortment of entertainment and family attractions and world-class golf. Popularly known as the Grand Strand, the Myrtle Beach area presents the quintessential vacation experience peppered with plenty of Southern hospitality.
For additional information on the Myrtle Beach area, visit www.visitmyrtlebeach.com or call (888) Myrtle-1.
